result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob E Niesen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, the Court STAYS the jail time pending appeal

--The Court authorizes transfer of jail term to Dane Co., so long as it is without electronic monitoring. 

---Mr. Niesen is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

**05/25/17 - The Court directs that the Defendant begin service of the conditional jail time on July 10, 2017 at 6pm. The Court authorizes that the jail time can be served in Ozaukee County jail so long as electronic monitoring is not utilized. 
The Court authorizes that Defendant may report earlier if arrangements are made with the Sheriff. **

Case called at 8:35am [mo]
Defendant Jacob E Niesen in court with Attorney Jonas Bednarek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
The Court questions Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Niesen

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, the Court STAYS the jail time pending appeal
--The Court authorizes transfer of jail term to Dane Co., so long as it is without electronic monitoring. 
---Mr. Niesen is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-- maintain absolute sobriety 
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random Urinalysis
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to provide DNA sample to designee upon demand

Firearm/Voting Prohibition Warnings given

Days credit for time already served:  2  days
recess:9:20am

NEXT: Create a Reminder for the Court to Review this Case in 6 months, regarding the status of the Appeal as it relates to the conditional jail time.

Case called at 1:24pm [mo]
Defendant Jacob E Niesen in court with Attorney Jonas Bednarek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court's Oral Ruling on the Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence Obtained as a Result of Unlawful Search and Seizure:

The Court indicates that it has read and reviewed Counsel's briefs; seeks clarification.
The Court and Counsel review transcript of 5/7/15 Motion Hearing

Arguments given by Counsel as to time of custodial status of Mr. Niesen
The Court and Counsel discuss Mr. Niesen's awareness of police presence at time of stop; analyze possible scenarios
The Court finds that the seizure first occurred when the Officer verbally summoned Mr. Niesen; the seizure did not occur before then because Mr. Niesen  was apparently unaware of the precense
The Court finds it is already established that the Trooper was not aware that the dropped item was drug paraphernalia until after custody began; the Trooper's awareness of the potentially illegal nature of the item did not occur until after the situation became custodial.

The Court and Counsel concur that the call made was an anonymous tip.
ADA Hall argues that the officer had reason to make a  stop despite the call being made by an anonymous tip
--The Court questions ADA Hall of the Trooper being able to confirm any of the facts that the anonymous reporter advised
--The Court and Counsel review the Kolk case law
--The Court questions ADA Hall of the existence of case law that has an anonymous tipster where the only items that the officer can confirm are innocent behaviors and where we don't have predictive behaviors. 
--ADA Hall cites State v. Sherry; The Court and Counsel review

The Court finds that the officer did NOT have reasonable suspicion or probable cause for the dentention which occurred the moment the officer summoned Mr. Niesen verbally. Further the Court notes, the information provided by the tip is insufficient because it is an anonymous tip and because the officer is only able to corroborate innocent facts from the tipster.


As to the Defendant's Post- Hearing Brief:
--As to Argument 1: The Court finds that it has previously ruled that Mr. Niesen was seized when the Officer verbally summoned him
--As to Argument 2:
--ADA Hall gives arguments against; in favor of the officer acting as a community care-taker
--Atty. Bednarek gives arguments for; gives possible reasons for erratic driving
--The Court and Counsel discuss additional possible reasons for erratic driving
--The Court questions Counsel as to if an anonymous tip is different depending on capacity of officer (community caretaker, probable cause, reasonable suspicion)
--The Court finds that the Officer was acting in a bona-fide community care taker function, the Officer was aware of the information from the anonymous tipster, then observes Mr. Niesen in the rest area; The Court gives further basis for finding.
--The Court does find the Trooper to be a credible witness
--Counsel give further arguments specifically regarding part 3 of the community caretaker exception
--The Court finds that the seizure occurred when the officer summoned Mr. Niesen did take place under the community caretaker function. The Court finds that all elements of the community caretaker function have been satisfied; gives basis. 
--The Court finds that the community care taker function was bona fide 

The Defendant's Motion to Suppress is Denied because the Officer was acting legitimately under the community care taker function.
The Court and Counsel discuss future scheduling; Atty. Bednarek indicates that he does already have a hearing scheduled for 8/13/15 but does expect it to remain on the calendar; Atty. Bednarek is to notify the Court upon this date not being available. 

The Court reminds Mr. Niesen that his bond and its conditions remain in effect. 
The Court indicates that if the parties wish to submit a written motion it will sign it.

recess:3:02pm 

NEXT: Status Conference: 8/13/2015 at 3:00pm
Transcript of motion hearing held on 05-07-15 before the Honorable Judge Koschnick
Defendants post hearing brief
Post hearing brief filed by the State
Oral ruling on July 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 9:22am [mo]
Defendant Jacob E Niesen in court with Attorney Jonas Bednarek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.


On the Defendant's 3/23/2015 Motion to Suppress Evidence Obtained as a Result of Unlawful Search & Seizure:

Trooper Todd Weinberger--sworn & testifies
--Direct examination by ADA Hall 
--Cross examination by Atty. Bednarek
--Questioning by the Court

Arguments given by ADA Hall
--Questioning by the Court
--Review of Case Law

Arguments given by Atty. Bednarek

Further arguments by Counsel and Questioning by the Court 

The Court finds the officer did have probable cause to search the vehicle once the stop occurred
The Court does not make a finding as to when the stop began at this time, to allow Counsel to brief this issue and determine the Defendant's knowledge of the squad car.

The Court reserves the right to find that the stop began when the Trooper first parked his squad car behind the Defendant's car 

The State is to submit a brief by June 8, 2015
The Defense is to submit a brief by June 22, 2015
The State can submit a reply brief by June 29, 2015 if necessary 

The Court reminds Mr. Niesen that his bond and its conditions remain in effect.
recess:10:40am

Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch III Intake: 
case called at 1:22pm. [MK]
Defendant Jacob E Niesen appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD appears for bond purposes only; Mr. Niesen has indicated that he intends to seek private counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to counsel given. Mr. Niesen indicates that he needs approximately three weeks to retain counsel. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of any illegal drugs
--no possession of drug paraphernalia unless in possession of a valid precription for such paraphernalia
--no possession of any syringes unless in possession of  a valid prescription for syringes
--Mr. Niesen is not to operate a motor vehicle with any non-prescribed controlled substances in his system 
recess 1:29pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/21/15 at 10:40am.  (2) Status Conference on 2/6/15 at 1:30pm (JA- please note in comments that case is still at Prelim stage)
